's second largest city with a population of approximately 80,000.  It is located in the Treasure Valley of Southwest

Nampa is located on Interstate 84 West between Caldwell and Meridian.  It is about 20 miles west of Boise on I-84.  It is about 40 miles east of Ontario, Oregon on I-84.

There is a Greyhound bus station

in the downtown area on 12th Avenue South. A few blocks away on 3rd st and 9th ave is a clean cool hotel the only one downtown.

There is a small municipal airport
in Nampa, but the closest place to catch large commercial flights is the Boise Airport (BOI).
Nampa does not have much in the way of public transit, but the historic downtown area is very walkable.

value: content=A 20,000 square foot museum featuring World War II era aircraft.
content=A train musem inside a quaint, old-fashioned train station.

content=Nampa is fairly unique in that the streets in the historic downtown area are oriented to be parallel and perpindicular to the railroad tracks rather than to cardinal directions.  Thus, at a certain point in town, the roads curve from a cardinal orientation the to the new orientation.  The most obvious part of the curve is on 12th Avenue South and East Roosevelt Avenue, near the Hasbrouck House.
content=One of the 12 major rodeos recognized by the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association.  It is held every year in July.  It is accompanied by a festival, Snake River Dayz.
content=Every Saturday from 9am - 1pm, Late April to Late October, in the historic downtown area.

content=A major event center located near I-84.  It hosts a wide variety of musical performances, athletic competitions, livestock exhibitions, and other events.  It includes a 120,000 square foot arena, an outdoor amphitheatre, a 100,000 square foot sports center, and the 97.500 square foot Idaho Horse Park.
content=A smaller venue that hosts a wide variety of events, including plays and musical performances.

Downtown Nampa has three notable used book dealers, all within walking distance of each other:

value: content=Specializing in rare and out-of-print books.

Downtown Nampa also has a variety of other small shops and businesses.

value: content=A new outdoor mall with a Costco, Target, Kohl's, and Best Buy.
content=A somewhat older mall on Nampa-Caldwell Boulevard that often seems to be struggling.  It is undergoing renovations.
content=An informal family restaurant in the downtown area that is particularly good for breakfast.
content=Quiet, friendly hostel located slightly in the country, with an authentic Idaho feel. Amenities include WiFi, breakfast fixings, a full kitchen, and very friendly staff.
directions=just off of I-84 at Exit 36

The local paper in Nampa is the Idaho Press-Tribune
